intro: Panzerina lanata f. kansuensis, commonly known as the Kansu hairy bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the grasslands of northern China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, lance-shaped leaves and bell-shaped, pale blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and thrives in well-drained soils. It is often found in open habitats such as meadows and slopes, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphological features and ecological adaptations.
